title: [Large-Scale] Application of Learning Analytics-Based Clustering for Customized E-Learning Design: A Mathematical Modeling Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational math knowledge (algebra, statistics, geometry) and basic data analysis skills
context.additional_context: Building a Customized Learning Support Environment for Enhancing Job Competencies of Current Practitioners: Application of Mathematical Modeling and Probabilistic Approaches for Analyzing Learner-Specific Achievement Patterns

learning_goals: Applying mathematical clustering algorithms (e.g., K-means) to learning behavior data, learners can classify learner types into three categories: slow learners, average learners, and advanced learners.
Learners can apply clustering results (distance matrices, centroid coordinates) derived from learning analytics to personalized learning path design.

Learners can utilize a diagnostic and feedback system combining assessment strategies based on Bloomâ€™s revised taxonomy (weighting multiple-choice/constructed-response items) with mathematical statistical analysis.

resources: Learning Progress and Time Data Collection Module

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
